Reason: The configuration option 'tombstone_warn_threshold' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it determines the threshold at which warnings are issued for tombstones (deleted data) in the database. A lower threshold can lead to increased warnings and potentially impact query performance due to increased tombstone scanning and filtering. On the other hand, a higher threshold can result in delayed warnings and potentially lead to increased memory consumption and slower query performance as tombstones accumulate in the database.
